tn.text: Yahweh continues telling Moses what he must tell Aaron and his sons.

tn.ref: in the place for killing it
tn.text: It can be made explicit that this refers to place where the animals for the burnt offerings are killed. See [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:10|1:10-11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: All the fat in it will be offered
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "The priest must offer all the fat in it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the stomach and intestines.
Translate these words the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:03:03|3:4]].
This is the part of the body on the sides of the backbone between the ribs and hipbone. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:03:03|3:4]].
This can be stated in active form. AT: "the priest must remove all this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: as an offering made with fire
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as a burnt offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "They must eat it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The same law applies to both of them
tn.text: "The law is the same for both of them"

tn.ref: to the priest who makes atonement with them
tn.text: The abstract noun "atonement" can be stated as a verb. AT: "to the priest who offers the sacrifice to atone for someone's sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
the coat or skin of a herd animal

tn.ref: that is baked in an oven ... that is cooked in a frying pan
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "that someone bakes in an oven ... that someone cooks in a frying pan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

This was probably a hollow object made of clay. A fire was lit under the oven, and the heat would bake the dough inside of the oven. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:02:04|2:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

This is a metal plate with rounded edges. The dough was placed in the pan and cooked over a fire. See how you translated "pan" in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:02:06|2:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

This is a thick plate made of either clay or metal. The plate was placed over a fire, and the dough cooked on top of the plate. See how you translated "flat iron pan" in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:02:04|2:5]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

tn.ref: of cakes made without yeast, but mixed with oil
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "of cakes he made without yeast but mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "cakes" refers to a thick bread.

tn.ref: of cakes made without yeast, but spread with oil
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "of thin cakes he made without yeast but spread with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "cakes" refers to a thin bread.

tn.ref: of cakes made with fine flour that is mixed with oil
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "of cakes he made with fine flour mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "cakes" refers to a thick bread. It is similar to the first type of bread except it is made with the finest flour.

tn.ref: cakes of bread made with yeast
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "cakes of bread he made with yeast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to a thick bread.
"The person who offers"

tn.ref: for the purpose of giving thanks
tn.text: The abstract noun "thanks" can be stated as a verb. AT: "for the purpose of thanking Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: the meat must be eaten ... it may be eaten
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "he must eat the meat ... he may eat it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Third is the ordinal number for three. AT: "after two days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This can be translated in active form. AT: "the person must burn it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: If any of the meat of the sacrifice of one's peace offering is eaten on the third day
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "If anyone eats the meat of his peace offering sacrifice on the third day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will not accept it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: neither will it be credited to the one who offered it
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "neither will Yahweh honor the sacrifice that the person offered" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: will carry the guilt of his sin
tn.text: A person being responsible for the sin he committed is spoken of as if he had to carry the guilt physically. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Any meat that touches an unclean thing must not be eaten
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "No one may eat meat that touches something unclean" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Something that Yahweh has stated is unfit to touch or eat is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This can be translated in active form. AT: "You must burn it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A person who is acceptable for God's purposes is spoken of as if the person were physically clean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
A person who is not acceptable for God's purposes is spoken of as if the person were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: that person must be cut off from his people
tn.text: A person being excluded from his community is spoken of as if he had been cut off from his people, as one would cut a piece of cloth or cut a branch from a tree. This can be translated in active form. AT: "that person may no longer live among his people" or "you must separate that person from his people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Something that Yahweh has stated is unfit to touch or eat is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: whether uncleanness of man, or of unclean beast
tn.text: Here "man" means humans in general. AT: "whether of a person or a beast"

tn.ref: or of some unclean and disgusting thing
tn.text: "or of some unclean thing that disgusts Yahweh"

tn.ref: that person must be cut off from his people
tn.text: A person being excluded from his community is spoken of as if he had been cut off from his people, as one would cut a piece of cloth or cut a branch from a tree. This can be translated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:07:19|7:20]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, "Speak to the people of Israel and say, 'You must eat no fat
tn.text: This has a quotation within a quotation. A direct quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "Then Yahweh spoke to Moses and told him to tell the people of Israel this: 'You must eat no fat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
"died but was not a sacrifice"

tn.ref: the fat of an animal torn by wild animals
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the fat of an animal that wild animals killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be translated in active form. AT: "you may use" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "burnt offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: that person must be cut off from his people
tn.text: A person being excluded from his community is spoken of as if he had been cut off from his people, as one would cut a piece of cloth or cut a branch from a tree. This can be translated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:07:19|7:20]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"You must not consume blood"
"in any of your homes" or "wherever you live"

tn.ref: So Yahweh spoke to Moses and said, "Speak to the people of Israel and say, 'He who offers
tn.text: This has a quotation within a quotation. A direct quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "Then Yahweh spoke to Moses and told him to tell the people of Israel this: 'He who offers" (See:[[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: The offering for Yahweh to be made by fire, his own hands must bring it
tn.text: The statement "his own hands must bring it" can be placed at the beginning of the sentence. The phrase "to be made by fire" can be stated in active form. AT: "He himself must bring the offering that he plans to burn as a sacrifice to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: his own hands must bring it
tn.text: Here "hands" represents the whole person. AT: "he must bring it himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
the front part of the animal's body below the neck

tn.ref: so that the breast may be waved as a wave offering before Yahweh
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "so that the priest can present it to Yahweh as a wave offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: may be waved as a wave offering before Yahweh
tn.text: Raising up the offering is a symbolic gesture that shows that the person is dedicating the sacrifice to Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
the upper part of the leg above the knee
This can be translated in active form. AT: "and present it as an offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "I" refers to Yahweh.
"that is given as an offering"

tn.ref: the offerings for Yahweh made by fire
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the burnt offerings for Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: that Yahweh commanded to be given them from the people of Israel
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that Yahweh commanded the people of Israel to give to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"that Moses anointed the priests"
Translate these words the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:03:15|3:17]].
This is the end of a speech started in verse [[:en:bible:notes:lev:07:28|7:29]].
